title: NewsBreak: EU Grants U.K. Brexit 'Flextension' Until Jan. 31
text:
© Reuters.

Investing.com - The European Union officially agreed to grant Britain's request for an extension to its Brexit date. The new date has been pushed back from Oct. 31 to Jan. 31.

President of the European Council Donald Tusk tweeted on Monday morning that ambassadors for the 27 European Union member states had agreed to a flexible extension until Jan. 31.

Tusk referred to the three month extension as a 'flextension' as the U.K. has the possibility of leaving the EU earlier than scheduled if Boris Johnson's Brexit deal is ratified before the new date of Jan. 31.

The U.K. Parliament is scheduled to vote later Monday on whether or not to hold a general election before Christmas, in a bid to try to ratify the withdrawal agreement agreed by the EU with Prime Minister Boris Johnson.

At 09:38, was up 0.14% at 1.2839.

was flat at 0.8639

The was down 0.3% at 7300.5.
description: NewsBreak: EU Grants U.K. Brexit 'Flextension' Until Jan. 31
